pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Friday, March 24, 2023 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local 

National Capital Region, Canada

11:05 a.m. The Prime Minister will welcome the President of the United States of America, Joe Biden, to Parliament Hill.

Note for media:

  • Pooled coverage

11:15 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the welcoming ceremony for the President of the United States of America, Joe Biden.

Note for media:

  • Pooled coverage 

11:20 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a bilateral meeting with the President of the United States of America, Joe Biden.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting

11:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in an expanded bilateral meeting with the President of the United States of America, Joe Biden. He will be joined by the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance, Chrystia Freeland, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Mélanie Joly, the Minister of Innovation, Science and Industry, François-Philippe Champagne, the Minister of International Trade, Export Promotion, Small Business and Economic Development, Mary Ng, the Minister of Natural Resources, Jonathan Wilkinson, the Minister of National Defence, Anita Anand, and the Minister of Environment and Climate Change, Steven Guilbeault.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks in the House of Commons. An address to Parliament from the President of the United States of America, Joe Biden, will follow. Sophie Grégoire Trudeau and the First Lady of the United States of America, Dr. Jill Biden, will be in attendance.

Note for media:

  • Pooled coverage

3:45 p.m. The Prime Minister and the President of the United States of America, Joe Biden, will hold a joint media availability.

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media are asked to arrive no later than 3:00 p.m.
  • Media interested in participating can contact media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca for details.

6:50 p.m. The Prime Minister and Sophie Grégoire Trudeau will host a dinner in honour of the President of the United States of America, Joe Biden, and the First Lady of the United States of America, Dr. Jill Biden. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks.

Note for media:

  • Pooled coverage of the Prime Minister’s remarks
